identity.short_description: An 18th-century chateau in the heart of Vexin, between Ile-de-France and Normandy, offering exclusive privatisation for weddings of up to 220 guests with 94 sleeping on-site across 34 rooms.
identity.network_membership: Domaines & Evenements collection (7 domaines de caractere)

location.natural_park: On the edge of the Vexin National Park
location.motorway_access: A15 or A13 from Paris (Porte de Clichy or Porte d'Auteuil)
nearby_attractions: Claude Monet's house and gardens in Giverny
Castles of Villarceaux, La Roche Guyon, and Ambleville
Canoe excursion along the Epte River
location.landscape_description: Peaceful green hills of Vexin, between Ile-de-France and Normandy, surrounded by centuries-old trees in an English landscape park

history.historical_narrative: For centuries weddings have been celebrated at this magnificent chateau. The first marriage in 1800 marked the beginning of a long history of love and celebrations. The company Domaines & Evenements SAS bought the castle in September 2021 and undertook a remarkable renovation during the winter of 2021-2022. The inauguration took place on June 2, 2022, with more than 350 guests. The chateau's elegant silhouette is not unlike that of Cheverny.
notable_architectural_features: Grand Gallery (220m2) with Hungarian Point parquet flooring and crystal chandeliers
Salon des Singes with exposed stone walls and fireplace
history.renovation_history: Extensive renovation during winter 2021-2022 by Domaines & Evenements. Grand Gallery renovated with radiant heating ceiling, soft lighting, Hungarian Point parquet, double-glazed windows, custom DJ booth. Lobby, Orangery, and iconic salons meticulously restored. New Salon des Pantheres created.

spaces.name: Grand Gallery (Grande Galerie)
notable_features: double-glazed windows for acoustic and thermal insulation
spaces.description: The castle's Grand Reception Gallery, completely renovated and air-conditioned, for a prestigious reception for up to 200 people with a dance floor (220 without). Features soft lighting, parquet flooring, and luxurious decor.

spaces.name: Grand Hall (Lobby)
spaces.description: The castle's lobby with grand staircase, ideal for indoor cocktails or welcome events. Opens directly onto the large terrace.

spaces.name: Salon des Singes
spaces.description: Ideal for relaxing moments over a cup of tea or wine tasting evenings.

spaces.name: Salon des Oiseaux (Bird Lounge)
spaces.description: Perfect for small dinners accommodating up to 20 people, or for more lively cocktails.

spaces.name: Salon d'Hiver (Winter Lounge)
spaces.description: A fallback solution for a secular ceremony in case of rain. Also suitable as a children's area and for professional meetings.

spaces.name: Salon des Pantheres
spaces.description: Suitable for games, meetings and evenings in small groups with an adjacent bar and terrace.

spaces.name: Giverny Room
spaces.description: Can accommodate up to 25 people, ideal for meetings or training sessions.

spaces.name: Impressionist Hall (Salle des Impressionnistes)
spaces.description: Can accommodate up to 150 people. Perfect for a secular ceremony in case of rain, for business meetings, or as a children's room.

spaces.name: Monet Room
spaces.description: Designed to accommodate up to 15 people, ideal for meetings or seminars.

spaces.name: Orangery
spaces.description: Indoor space open to the Impressionist Garden, serves as a rain backup for ceremonies and suitable for brunch.

spaces.name: La Grande Terrasse
notable_features: views of the castle and Vexin hills
spaces.description: Gravel terrace of over 1,000m2 for cocktails and brunches, with views of the castle and the Vexin hills.

spaces.name: La Clairiere (The Clearing)
notable_features: round clearing on the edge of the forest
spaces.description: A round clearing on the edge of the forest, with captivating charm, perfect for ceremonies.

spaces.name: La Roseraie (Rose Garden)
spaces.description: Garden with its lawn refreshed by ponds.

spaces.name: Le Jardin des Impressionnistes
notable_features: bushes and red flowers along a paved path
spaces.description: Garden with bushes and red flowers along a paved path, adjacent to the Orangery.

spaces.name: L'Allee des Fleurs (The Alley of Flowers)
spaces.description: Outdoor walking path through the estate.

spaces.name: La Terrasse du Salon des Pantheres
notable_features: adjacent to the Panther Lounge bar
spaces.description: Terrace adjacent to the Salon des Pantheres and its bar.

spaces.name: The Church
spaces.description: Stone church with a bell tower, located approximately 100m from the castle, available for ceremonies.

spaces.name: 6-Hectare Park
notable_features: centuries-old plane trees, oaks, ash trees and chestnuts
spaces.description: The park retains its English landscape style with centuries-old native trees. Star-shaped alleys offer magnificent panoramas. A lake and exotic species such as cedars and horse chestnuts were added in the early 19th century.

accommodation.bridal_suite_description: Dedicated bridegroom's room in the castle, among the refined rooms steeped in rich history and authentic charm.

buildings.name: Le Chateau (Castle Rooms)
buildings.description: Rooms steeped in rich history and authentic charm, between tradition and elegance. Spacious, bright and comfortable, including a dedicated bridegroom's room. Each room is unique and tastefully decorated to convey 18th-century refinement.

buildings.name: L'Orangerie (Orangery Rooms)
buildings.description: A haven of softness, comfort and tranquility, particularly suitable for families. Overlooking the delightful Impressionist Garden. Cocooning experience in a cozy and warm setting, where every detail is designed for well-being.

buildings.name: Maison des Fleurs (Flower House)
buildings.description: 1-minute walk from the estate. 5 rooms sleeping 13 people, with 5 bathrooms, equipped kitchen, and private garden.

buildings.name: Maison de l'Epte
buildings.description: 1-minute walk from the estate. 5 rooms sleeping 14 people, with 4 bathrooms, equipped kitchen, and private garden.

buildings.name: Maison de l'Epicerie
buildings.description: 1-minute walk from the estate. 1 bedroom sleeping 2 people, with 1 bathroom, kitchenette, and private garden.

buildings.name: Maison de la Violette
buildings.description: Part of the estate houses complex, listed alongside Maison de l'Epicerie, Maison de l'Epte, and Maison des Fleurs.

nearby_accommodation: Cottages available nearby in the village

pricing.starting_price_description: Low season (November to March) venue hire for 2 days/1 night.
pricing.rental_period_description: 2 days/1 night or 3 days/2 nights. Additional days and nights available for a competitive supplement.
price_includes: Round tables and Napoleon chairs (red cake) for 200 people
Dance floor in the Grand Gallery

catering.brunch_description: Brunch the next day on the Large Terrace with views of the Castle and the Vexin hills, or a picnic in the park clearing. Also possible in the Grand Gallery or Orangery.

ceremony.chapel_details: Stone church with a bell tower, located approximately 100m from the castle, available for ceremonies.
outdoor_ceremony_locations: La Clairiere (round clearing on the edge of the forest)
ceremony.rain_backup_plan: Orangery (open to the Impressionist Garden), Salon d'Hiver, Impressionist Hall (Salle des Impressionnistes, up to 150 people), or Grand Hall for indoor ceremonies.

amenities.gardens_description: 6 hectares of centennial park in English landscape style with centuries-old plane trees, oaks, ash trees and chestnuts. Star-shaped alleys cross the park. A lake and species such as cedars and horse chestnuts were added in the early 19th century. Includes the Rose Garden, Impressionist Garden, Alley of Flowers, and multiple terraces.

nearby_activities: Canoe excursion along the Epte River
Hot air balloon rides over the Vexin countryside
Claude Monet's house and gardens in Giverny (15-20 minutes)
Castles of Villarceaux, La Roche Guyon, and Ambleville
activities.fireworks_details: Fireworks show available on request, arranged through the chateau's fireworks provider.

technical.furniture_details: Round tables and Napoleon chairs (red cake) for 200 people. Garden furniture and umbrellas provided for outdoor cocktails.
technical.climate_control: Air conditioning in the Grand Gallery (radiant heating ceiling, double-glazed windows for thermal insulation). Some bedrooms also air-conditioned.

accessibility.accessibility_details: Elevator for wheelchair access. 3 accessible rooms (PMR) for those with reduced mobility.

parking.parking_type: Castle parking, Parking des Platanes, and Epte car park for gites

policies.noise_restrictions: Outdoor activities until 10:00 PM. Indoor events in the Grand Gallery until 4:00 AM.

wedding_day_details.typical_timeline: Ceremony in the park or chapel, cocktail on the Grande Terrasse or in the Grand Hall, dinner in the Grand Gallery (up to 200 seated with dance floor), soiree with DJ and optional fireworks, brunch the next day on the Grande Terrasse or in the Orangery.
wedding_day_details.typical_weekend_flow: Day 1: Arrival, ceremony in the park or chapel (100m away), cocktail on the terrace or in the Grand Hall, dinner in the Grand Gallery, party and dancing with DJ. Day 2: Brunch on the Grande Terrasse with views of the castle and Vexin hills, or picnic in the park clearing.
